transcripts.text: All right, welcome back to Problem Solver Politics.  I am your host, Carden Ellis, with Cody the Oracle.
Hey, everybody.

And I'm really excited about today's podcast.  I mean, I've always wanted to do one of those wrecked thumbnails, right, where just somebody that I disagree with gets absolutely put in their place by a sea of facts and math.  And finally, it happened.  Anti-Yang, Anna Kasparian on The Young Turks.  has been campaigning for Bernie Sanders against Andrew Yang for a really long time.  And then finally, actually, with pure positivity, nothing but math and facts, a bunch of gamers actually rebutted the dismissive ideas of the freedom dividend.  It was just beautiful.  It was absolutely beautiful.  We're going to talk about it today.  Almost as kind of cool as all the Georgetown kids that came out to see Andrew Yang.  and just packed the basketball court that he was going to be in.  I mean, what a beautiful day.  What a beautiful day for the Yang gang.  Cody, just fill our audience in.  What's going on?

They pretty much just go on some of the kind of misconceptions or misunderstandings about the Freedom Dividend, and then we'll go through kind of how the Yang Gang, so to speak, responded. So I'll play it and you guys can hear exactly the kind of stuff and then we'll get into the response in a second.

Especially if people who are getting disability have to choose between that and their disability checks.  That's how we're doing it. Wait a minute.  Andrew Yang says repeatedly no one's supposed to live on $12,000 a year.  That's actually not the point of the freedom dividend.  It's not what it's there for.  It's there for other reasons.

The leftists over there at TYT don't say this about WIC saying, oh, it's not good to give people $400 in food stamps.  How dare you ask somebody to live off of $400 with food stamps?  No, it's supplemental food assistance.

And people on the left go, well, that's crazy.  Why can't you live on it?  And he's like, because that's not the plan.  So I think a lot of it comes from just fundamentally people having different understandings of exactly what he's trying to achieve.
Or how about just not understanding?

isn't true?  that's what I wanted to say.
